title.narrative: Kasanka Trust Community Relations Project: Strengthening Democracy and Livelihoods Capacities in Kafinda Game Management Area

description.narrative: Kasanka Trust Limited Community Relations Project (KTL CR) was established in 1997. It serves 80000 people residing in the chiefdom of Chitambo. The project aims at reducingpoverty by supporting local communities in community based conservation income gene rating activities capacity building natural resources management and effectiveparticipation in decision making. The project is demand driven and community representatives actively participate in monitoring and evaluation of the programme. The Embassy of Fi nland has supported the KTL Community Relations (KTL CR) project in three phases namely:Phase 1 period Nov 2004-Oct 2005 total grant ?41 000Phase 2 period 21.8.2006-30.4.2008 total grant ?42 000Phase 3A period 8.1.2010-31.8.2011 total grant ?55 500The obje ctive has been to enhance the local economy in the Kafinda Game Management Area through improved management and sustainable use of natural resources. This project covers KTL CR project activities for two years Apr 2012 - Apr 2014. This phase of KTL CR proj ect intends to expand successful initiatives consolidate results achieved and to strengthen capacities with a view to enhance the sustainability and organisational capacity of the community based structures already established in the Kafinda Game Managemen t Area (GMA).There are two project objectives:1. To enhance the management of the resources of the Kafinda GMA by GMA institutions (CRB VAGS traditional authorities) through strengthened capacity oflocal institutions that respect good governance principles .2. To improve sustainable livelihoods for the Kafinda GMA population.
